intro: Tetrapterys aristeguietae, commonly known as the Aristeguieta's tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
